page.title: 04Honey Farm In Cwmdare
page.content:
Each box produces 30lbs of honey.The honeycombs are placed in a machine which spins the honey out.The honey can either be piped into a large tank or into a milk churn.The honey is then taken out and put into jars. The honey is either sold at the farm or taken to North Wales to be sold to the tourists. To prevent the bees from dying Mr. Dublon has to feed his bees 2 tonnes of sugar in winter.
Because of this fact Mr.Dublon's "bee industry" is not a very profitable concern because he has to spend lots of money during the six cold months of the winter. In Wales today there are about 1000 amateur beekeepers.Mr.Dublon is the "Principality Beekeeping Adviser for Wales."
